definition: to break out (of disease etc)/to suddenly get rich (or prominent)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Most cases detected in other provinces have been linked directly to the outbreak in Uige.
sentences.chinese: 在其它省發現的大多數病例與威熱的暴發直接有關。

sentences.english: When the snow melts, the mountain stream becomes a deluge.
sentences.chinese: 雪融化時，山間溪流變成山洪暴發。

sentences.english: Occasional regional and local armed conflicts flare up, and economic competition is becoming ever more acute.
sentences.chinese: 局部地區的武裝衝突時有暴發，經濟競爭更爲加劇。

sentences.english: You can tell he is a parvenu.
sentences.chinese: 你看他財大氣粗，就知道他是個暴發戶。

sentences.english: A lot of these newly rich people are just big bootleggers, you know.
sentences.chinese: 有很多這樣的暴發戶都是大私酒販子，你要知道。

sentences.english: A parvenu swaggers by oneself at a party.
sentences.chinese: 有個暴發戶在舞會上神氣活現地四處走動。

sentences.english: Sometimes mountain torrents swept down, flooding the fields.
sentences.chinese: 有時山洪暴發，淹沒農田。

sentences.english: History, outbreaks of several anti-exploitation of the peasant uprising against oppression.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上曾暴發過多次反剝削反壓迫的農民起義。

sentences.english: Objective To find out the epidemiological feature of Yunnan Endemic Fulminating Myocarditis(YEFM).
sentences.chinese: 目的尋找雲南地方性暴發性心肌炎流行病學規律。

sentences.english: There has been no evidence of outbreaks of RVF in urban areas.
sentences.chinese: 沒有證據顯示在城市地區暴發裂谷熱。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the cause of a measles outbreak in Wengyuan County.
sentences.chinese: 目的分析廣東省翁源縣一起麻疹暴發的原因。

sentences.english: Disease outbreaks are a serious constraint to aquaculture development.
sentences.chinese: 病害暴發嚴重製約了水產養殖業的發展。

sentences.english: Currently, 11 governorates are known to be affected by the outbreak.
sentences.chinese: 目前已知有11個省受到此次暴發的影響。

sentences.english: The settlers already were calling themselves "Texans." Minor hostilities broke out between Texans and local Mexican officials.
sentences.chinese: 德克薩斯人與當地的墨西哥官員暴發了一些小衝突。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the efficacy of emergency orthotopic liver transplantation in treating patients with fulminant hepatic failure.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討急診肝臟移植對暴發性肝功能衰竭的療效。

sentences.english: The outbreak is believed to have begun in Uige Province in October 2004.
sentences.chinese: 據認爲，暴發於2004年10月在威熱省開始。

definition: to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
